channel.title: Decoder
channel.description:
i've seen on some sources that passwords don't get encodered and some do.
I have been looking at some stuff and realised to believe it uses md5 encoding. But i tried to decode it and it dosen't work.
If anyone knows what it encodes it to, that would be great because some people on my server want to change there pass's but the password is encoded.

item.title: Decoder
item.dc:creator: @Pk_strenght_LTD Pk strenght LTD ©
item.description:
@Pk_strenght_LTD wrote:

About the decoding. The some server “creators” just dont wanted to anyone notice the password like it.
They just added decode.
Why? Becose some programs can check your pass when you download any program…
Same happend to me XD

Read full topic

@dog_eats_dog wrote:

item.title: Decoder
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

ok ill give it a shot

Nope. Its the same. I don’t think its this. Hmm…

I thought it was md5 because look at the pass command

if (command.startsWith("pass")) { playerPass = command.substring(5); sendMessage("Your new pass is \""+command.substring(5)+"\""); String hashPW = md5(command.substring(5)); playerPass = hashPW; }

Notice is says “hashPW” is playerPass and and hashPW is what the player types after ::pass, md5.

Read full topic

item.title: Decoder
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

Its stupid, I might have an idea tho.

Sorry for the double post, But i have an idea (I needed to get the attention from the double post ^^)

Ok look in playerhandler and find:

characterfile.write("character-password = ", 0, 21);

Underneath you should see:

			characterfile.write("character-password = ", 0, 21);
			characterfile.write(plr.playerPass, 0, plr.playerPass.length());
			characterfile.newLine();
			characterfile.newLine();

If you don’t see it like that, Change it to that. Compile And see what happens?

Read full topic

item.title: Decoder
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Yeah i know. It encodes it into something, as i said, i thought it was md5 but i was wrong.

item.title: Decoder
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“xxl3th4lxx, post:3, topic:158514”]247-143-36-119-233-73-190-226-209-42-44-84-15-182-8-79
The above text is a password. The password is “tigger”[/quote]

This happens with almost every server out there, I recommend download a new source, And replace the character files with the one you downloaded that will work “We hope” Or just download a new source altogether.

Read full topic
